info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued October 5 at 7:42PM EDT until October 6 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected.
* WHERE...Coastal Georgetown County.
* WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 10 PM EDT this evening. For the High Rip Current Risk, from 6 AM EDT Monday through Monday evening.
* IMPACTS...Vulnerable causeways to and from local beaches may experience minor coastal flooding. Low-lying roads and locations along the Intracoastal Waterway and adjacent tidal creeks may observe minor coastal flooding. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction:
Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

parameter.value: COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM EDT MONDAY THROUGH MONDAY EVENING
